results.title: Hope is not a method (2nd revision)
results.creator_credit: Planned Parenthood Center of Syracuse and Wexler Film Productions
results.brief_description: Cites and describes nine contraceptive methods with anatomically explicit diagrams. States the advantages of withdrawal, rhythm, spermicidal chemicals, the cap, the condom, the diaphragm, the pill, the IUD and sterilization.

results.title: Hope is not a method
results.brief_description: The purpose of this film is to convey and illustrate the various methods of birth control. Seven types of contraception, in addition to vasectomy and tubal ligation are illustrated by means of animation and live action.

results.title: Hope for the handicapped
results.creator_credit: Australian National Film Board and State Film Centre of Victoria
results.brief_description: This film documents what was, for its time, a revolutionary breakthrough in occupational therapy - the pursuit of simple industrial vocation in sheltered workshops. A range of Victorian sheltered workshops are surveyed, and the filmmakers are keen to promote the greater satisfaction afforded their subjects by work which is both financially rewarding and socially useful.

results.brief_description: For Phillip Murray basketball is more than just a game, it’s an escape, it’s his life, it’s his passion. This Digital Storytelling project was created in partnership with Arts Victoria and the Koorie Heritage Trust Inc.

results.title: Hoop culture
results.brief_description: Created in response to a class assignment to offer a visual interpretation of ‘cultural identity’, this short After Effects animation focuses itself on different aspects of the ‘hoop culture’ of amateur basketball around melbourne.

results.title: Hook, line and sinker
results.creator_credit: Esso Film Unit, Andrew Rice and Roy Layzell
results.brief_description: A description of the trip made by a new type of line fishing vessel on her maiden voyage to northern waters. Demonstrates the modern equipment of the Scottish-built ship with its refrigeration, line hauling tackle and diesel engine and brings out the skill and efficiency of the crew.

results.title: Hoodwink [DVD]
results.creator_credit: CB Films (France), New South Wales Film Corporation, Pom Oliver, Errol Sullivan and Claude Whatham
results.brief_description: John Hargreaves stars as Martin Stang, a character based on a real-life bank robber and conman, in this Australian “crime caper” film. Martin attempts to ease the burden of his time in a New South Wales jail by pretending to be blind. While he succeeds in fooling the authorities into giving him special treatment, unexpected complications arise when Martin meets Sarah, (Judy Davis) the wife of a local lay preacher, and becomes emotionally involved. The stellar Australian cast also includes Wendy Hughes, Colin Friels, Max Cullen, Michael Caton and Geoffrey Rush in his first film role. Judy Davis won the 1981 AFI Award for Best Actress in a Supporting Role for her performance.

results.title: Honky Tonk freeway
results.creator_credit: AFD, Universal Pictures, Don Boyd, Howard W. Koch and John Schlesinger
results.brief_description: When a new freeway is built that bypasses the tiny but thriving Florida town of Ticlaw, depriving it of the livelihood it garners from passing motorists, the mayor and other oddball citizens of the town dream up hair-brained schemes as a lure to the tourist trade. The film follows a group of equally eccentric range of travellers who inadvertently find themselves in Ticlaw—a place they never intended to visit. Cast includes Beau Bridges, Hume Cronyn, Beverly D’Angelo, William Devane, Teri Garr and Geraldine Page.
